Point-to-Point Subinterfaces - In hub and spoke topologies:
  • Subinterfaces act as leased lines
  • Each point-to-point subinterface requires its own subnet

Multipoint Subinterfaces â€“ In partial-mesh and full-mesh topologies:
  • Subinterfaces act as NBMA so they do not resolve the split horizon issue
  • Can save address space because it uses a single subnet
Rollover the Point-to-Point Subinterface and the Multipoint Subinterface text to see more information.
